paratablecell.paratabletxt: The warning lights and indicators on the instrument cluster, center panel and outside rear view mirrors inform the driver of the status of the vehicle’s various systems.

titlegroupcell.title: Warning lights and indicators displayed on the instrument cluster

om_body.p: For the purpose of explanation, the following illustrations display all warning lights and indicators illuminated.

paraselectitem.title: Multi-information display (7-inch display [when analog speedometer is displayed])
Multi-information display (7-inch display [when digital speedometer is displayed])

om_body.p: Warning lights inform the driver of malfunctions in the indicated vehicle’s systems.

entry.p: Low engine oil pressure warning light*1, 2 (→)
Low engine oil level warning light*1 (if equipped) (→)
Continuously variable transmission fluid temperature warning light (if equipped) (→)
Brake Override System warning light/Drive-Start Control warning light (if equipped)*1, 2 (→)
Electric power steering system warning light*1 (→)
Electric power steering system warning light*1 (→)
Smart entry & start system indicator (if equipped) (→)
Driver’s and front passenger’s seat belt reminder light (→)
Rear passengers’ seat belt reminder lights (if equipped) (→)
Toyota parking assist-sensor OFF indicator*1 (if equipped) (→)

footnote.p: These lights come on when the engine switch is turned to ON to indicate that a system check is being performed. They will turn off after the engine is started, or after a few seconds. There may be a malfunction in a system if the lights do not come on, or turn off. Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer.
Vehicles with a multi-information display: As these lights are displayed on the multi-information display, they will not turn on when a system check, as described in *1 above, is being performed.

attention_para.title: If a safety system warning light does not come on
attention_para.p: Should a safety system light such as the ABS and SRS warning light not come on when you start the engine, this could mean that these systems are not available to help protect you in an accident, which could result in death or serious injury. Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer immediately if this occurs.

om_body.p: The indicators inform the driver of the operating state of the vehicle’s various systems.

entry.p: Dynamic radar cruise control indicator (if equipped) (→, )
BSM outside rear view mirror indicators*4, 5, 6 (if equipped) (→)
Toyota parking assist-sensor OFF indicator*1, 2 (if equipped) (→)
Smart entry & start system indicator*7 (if equipped) (→)

footnote.p: These lights come on when the engine switch is turned to ON to indicate that a system check is being performed. They will turn off after the engine is started, or after a few seconds. There may be a malfunction in a system if the lights do not come on, or turn off. Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer.
This light comes on when the system is turned off.
Depending on the operating condition, the color and illuminating/flashing state of the light change.

footnote.p_sub: In order to confirm operation, the BSM outside rear view mirror indicators illuminate in the following situations:

list1_item.itemtxt: When the engine switch is in ON, the BSM function is enabled on of the multi-information display.
When the BSM function is enabled on of the multi-information display, the engine switch is in ON.
If the system is functioning correctly, the BSM outside rear view mirror indicators will turn off after a few seconds.
If the BSM outside rear view mirror indicators do not illuminate or do not turn off, there may be a malfunction in the system.
If this occurs, have the vehicle inspected by by your Toyota dealer.

footnote.p_sub: These lights come on when the engine switch is turned to ON to indicate that a system check is being performed. They will turn off after the engine is started, or after a few seconds. There may be a malfunction in a system if the lights do not come on, or turn off. Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer.

footnote.p: This light illuminates on the outside rear view mirrors.
Vehicles with a multi-information display: This light illuminates on the multi-information display.
When the outside temperature is approximately 3°C (37°F) or lower, this indicator will flash for approximately 10 seconds, then stay on.
This light illuminates on the center panel.

calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: Displays the engine speed in revolutions per minute
Displays the outside temperature within the range of -40°C (-40°F) to 50°C (122°F)

calloutitem.callouttxt: Shift position and gear position indicator (if equipped) (→)

calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: Displays the engine coolant temperature
Changes the item displayed on the drive monitor display.
The “DISP” switch on the steering wheel can also be used to change the item displayed on the drive monitor display.
Displays the quantity of fuel remaining in the tank

att_list1_item.itemtxt: In the following situations, the correct outside temperature may not be displayed, or the display may take longer than normal to change:

att_list2_item.itemtxt: When stopped, or driving at low speeds (less than 25 km/h [16 mph])
When the outside temperature has changed suddenly (at the entrance/exit of a garage, tunnel, etc.)

att_list1_item.itemtxt: When “--” or “E” is displayed, the system may be malfunctioning. Take your vehicle to your Toyota dealer.

attention_para.title: The information display at low temperatures
attention_para.p: Allow the interior of the vehicle to warm up before using the liquid crystal information display. At extremely low temperatures, the information display monitor may respond slowly, and display changes may be delayed.

For example, there is a lag between the driver’s shifting and the new gear number appearing on the display. This lag could cause the driver to downshift again, causing rapid and excessive engine braking and possibly an accident resulting in death or injury.

attention_para.title: To prevent damage to the engine and its components

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Do not let the indicator needle of the tachometer enter the red zone, which indicates the maximum engine speed.

The engine may be overheating if the high engine coolant temperature warning light comes on. In this case, immediately stop the vehicle in a safe place, and check the engine after it has cooled completely. (→)

advanced_operation.p: Use the clock adjustment buttons to adjust the clock.

list1_item.itemtxt: Press the “+” button to adjust the displayed time forward.
Press the “-” button to adjust the displayed time backward.

calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: Displays the engine speed in revolutions per minute
Displays the outside temperature within the range of -40°C (-40°F) to 50°C (122°F)
Presents the driver with a variety of vehicle data (→)Displays warning messages if a malfunction occurs (→)

calloutitem.callouttxt: Shift position and gear position indicator (if equipped) (→)

calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: Displays the quantity of fuel remaining in the tank
Displays the engine coolant temperature

att_list1_item.itemtxt: In the following situations, the correct outside temperature may not be displayed, or the display may take longer than normal to change:

att_list2_item.itemtxt: When stopped, or driving at low speeds (less than 25 km/h [16 mph])
When the outside temperature has changed suddenly (at the entrance/exit of a garage, tunnel, etc.)

att_list1_item.itemtxt: When “--” or “E” is displayed, the system may be malfunctioning. Take your vehicle to your Toyota dealer.

attention_para.title: The information display at low temperatures
attention_para.p: Allow the interior of the vehicle to warm up before using the liquid crystal information display. At extremely low temperatures, the information display monitor may respond slowly, and display changes may be delayed.

For example, there is a lag between the driver’s shifting and the new gear number appearing on the display. This lag could cause the driver to downshift again, causing rapid and excessive engine braking and possibly an accident resulting in death or injury.

attention_para.title: To prevent damage to the engine and its components

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Do not let the indicator needle of the tachometer enter the red zone, which indicates the maximum engine speed.

The engine may be overheating if the engine coolant temperature gauge is in the red zone (H). In this case, immediately stop the vehicle in a safe place, and check the engine after it has cooled completely. (→)

basic_operation.title: Changing the display
basic_operation.p: Press the display change button until the desired item is displayed.

list1_item.itemtxt_sub: Displays the total distance the vehicle has been driven.
Displays the distance the vehicle has been driven since the meter was last reset. Trip meters A and B can be used to record and display different distances independently.
To reset, display the desired trip meter and press and hold the display change button.
Displays the meter light control display.

list2_item.itemtxt: The brightness of the meter can be adjusted separately for when the tail lights are on and off.
To adjust the brightness, display the meter light control display and press and hold the display change button.

titlegroupcell.title: Adjusting the clock (vehicles without navigation/multimedia system)

advanced_operation.title: Adjusting the minute to “00”

stepitem.steptxt: Press or to select of the multi-information display.

advanced_operation.p: Press the to set the clock to the beginning of the nearest hour.

stepitem.steptxt: Press or to select of the multi-information display.
Press or to select an item to be changed.
Press or to change the setting.

titlegroupcell.title: Adjusting the clock (vehicles with navigation/multimedia system)

advanced_operation.title: Clock adjustment
advanced_operation.p: The clocks on the following can be adjusted on the audio system screen.

advanced_operation.title: Setting the clock to be adjusted automatically by GPS

stepitem.steptxt: Select “Auto adjust by GPS” to set to on.
Select “Auto adjust by GPS” to set to off.

list1_item.itemtxt: Hour: Select “-” or “+” of “Hours” to adjust the hour.
Minute: Select “-” or “+” of “Minutes” to adjust the minute.
“:00”: Select to set the clock to the beginning of the nearest hour.
list1_item.itemtxt_sub: e.g.

advanced_operation.title: Changing the clock between 12-hour/24-hour format

stepitem.steptxt: Select “24-Hour time format” and then on/off.

advanced_operation.p_sub: When set to off, the clock is displayed in 12 hour time format.

note_para.title: Clock settings screen (vehicles with navigation/multimedia system)
note_para.p: If “Clock : 00” is displayed when is selected on the multi-information display, the system may be malfunctioning. Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer.

Displays the quantity of fuel remaining in the tank
Displays the engine coolant temperature

note_para.p: The gauges and meters can be customized in of the multi-information display. (→)

For example, there is a lag between the driver’s shifting and the new gear number appearing on the display. This lag could cause the driver to downshift again, causing rapid and excessive engine braking and possibly an accident resulting in death or injury.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Do not let the indicator needle of the tachometer enter the red zone, which indicates the maximum engine speed.

The engine may be overheating if the engine coolant temperature gauge is in the red zone (H). In this case, immediately stop the vehicle in a safe place, and check the engine after it has cooled completely. (→)

list1_item.itemtxt_sub: Displays the total distance the vehicle has been driven.

To reset, display the desired trip meter and press and hold the display change button.

list2_item.itemtxt: The brightness of the meter can be adjusted separately for when the tail lights are on and off.

stepitem.steptxt: Press or to select of the multi-information display.

advanced_operation.title: Clock adjustment

Minute: Select “-” or “+” of “Minutes” to adjust the minute.

stepitem.steptxt: Select “24-Hour time format” and then on/off.

note_para.title: Clock settings screen (vehicles with navigation/multimedia system)
note_para.p: If “Clock : 00” is displayed when is selected on the multi-information display, the system may be malfunctioning. Have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer.

basic_description.p: A variety of driving-related information can be displayed. Vehicle settings can also be changed.

note_para.title: Liquid crystal display
note_para.p: Small spots or light spots may appear on the display. This phenomenon is characteristic of liquid crystal displays, and there is no problem continuing to use the display.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: When operating the drive monitor display while driving, pay extra attention to the safety of the area around the vehicle.
Do not look continuously at the drive monitor display while driving as you may fail to see pedestrians, objects on the road, etc. ahead of the vehicle.

attention_para.title: The information display at low temperatures

basic_operation.p: To change the displayed item, press the display change button or the “DISP” switch.
basic_operation.p_sub: Each time the button/switch is pressed, the displayed item will be changed.

list1_item.itemtxt_sub: “ODO” will be displayed.
Displays the total distance the vehicle has been driven.
“TRIP A”/“TRIP B” will be displayed.
Displays the distance the vehicle has been driven since the meter was last reset. Trip meters A and B can be used to record and display different distances independently.
To reset, display the desired trip meter and press and hold the display change button or the “DISP” switch.
Displays instantaneous current fuel consumption.
“AVG.” will be displayed.
Displays the average fuel consumption since the function was reset.
To reset, display the average fuel consumption and press and hold the display change button or the “DISP” switch.
“RANGE” will be displayed.
Displays driving range with remaining fuel.
This distance is computed based on your average fuel consumption. As a result, the actual distance that can be driven may differ from that displayed.

When only a small amount of fuel is added to the tank, the display may not be updated.When refueling, turn the engine switch off. If the vehicle is refueled without turning the engine switch off, the display may not be updated.
Displays the average vehicle speed since engine start.
Displays the meter light control display.

list2_item.itemtxt: The brightness of the meter can be adjusted separately for when the tail lights are on and off.
To adjust the brightness, display the meter light control display and press and hold the display change button or the “DISP” switch.

calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: During Eco-friendly acceleration (Eco driving), the Eco Driving Indicator Light will turn on. When the acceleration exceeds the Zone of Eco driving, or when the vehicle is stopped, the light turns off.
Suggests the Zone of Eco driving with current Eco driving ratio based on acceleration.

calloutitem.callouttxt: Eco driving ratio based on acceleration
calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: If the acceleration exceeds the Zone of Eco driving, the right side of the Eco Driving Indicator Zone Display will blink.
At this time, the Eco Driving Indicator Light will turn off.

note_para.title: Eco Driving Indicator
note_para.p: Eco Driving Indicator will not operate under the following conditions:

att_list1_item.itemtxt: The shift lever is in any position other than D.
The driving mode is set to sport mode. (if equipped)
The vehicle speed is approximately 130 km/h (80 mph) or higher.

advanced_description.title: Meter display settings that can be changed

list1_item.itemtxt_sub: Select to enable/disable the Eco Driving Indicator Light.

basic_operation.title: Customizing the display

stepitem.steptxt: To change to the customizing mode screen, display the odometer and then press and hold the display change button or the “DISP” switch.
Press the display change button or the “DISP” switch to change the displayed item.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: Each time the switch is pressed, the displayed item will be changed.

stepitem.steptxt: Press and hold the display change button or the “DISP” switch to change the setting of the item.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: Each time the switch is pressed and held, the setting will be changed.

basic_operation.p: To exit the settings screen, press the display change button until is displayed, then press and hold the button.

attention_para.title: Cautions during setting up the display
attention_para.p: If the engine is running when changing the display settings, ensure that the vehicle is parked in a place with adequate ventilation. In a closed area such as a garage, exhaust gases including harmful carbon monoxide (CO) may collect and enter the vehicle. This may lead to death or a serious health hazard.

attention_para.title: During setting up the display
attention_para.p: To prevent battery discharge, ensure that the engine is running while setting up the display features.

calloutitem.callouttxt: Driving support system status display area
calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: Displays an image when the following systems are operating and a menu icon other than is selected:

calloutlist_item.itemtxt: LDA (Lane Departure Alert with steering control) (if equipped)
Dynamic radar cruise control full-speed range (if equipped)

calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: By selecting menu icons on the multi-information display, a variety of driving-related information can be displayed. The multi-information display can also be used to change display settings and other vehicle settings.
Warning or advice pop-up displays are also displayed in certain situations.

calloutitem.callouttxt: Driving support system status display area
calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: Displays an image when the following systems are operating and a menu icon other than is selected:

calloutlist_item.itemtxt: LDA (Lane Departure Alert with steering control) (if equipped)
Dynamic radar cruise control full-speed range (if equipped)

calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: By selecting menu icons on the multi-information display, a variety of driving-related information can be displayed. The multi-information display can also be used to change display settings and other vehicle settings.
Warning or advice pop-up displays are also displayed in certain situations.

basic_description.title: Menu icons
basic_description.p: The menu icons will be displayed by pressing the or meter control switch.

note_para.title: Liquid crystal display
note_para.p: Small spots or light spots may appear on the display. This phenomenon is characteristic of liquid crystal displays, and there is no problem continuing to use the display.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: When operating the multi-information display while driving, pay extra attention to the safety of the area around the vehicle.
Do not look continuously at the multi-information display while driving as you may fail to see pedestrians, objects on the road, etc. ahead of the vehicle.

attention_para.title: The information display at low temperatures

basic_operation.p: The multi-information display is operated using the meter control switches.

calloutitem.callouttxt: /: Select menu icons/: Change displayed content, scroll up/down the screen and move the cursor up/down
Press: Enter/SetPress and hold: Reset/Display customizable items

calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: Linked with the hands-free system, sending or receiving call is displayed. For details regarding the hands-free system, refer to the “Navigation and Multimedia System Owner’s Manual”.

list1_item.itemtxt_sub: Displays driving range with remaining fuel. Use the displayed values as a reference only.
This distance is computed based on your average fuel consumption. As a result, the actual distance that can be driven may differ from that displayed.

When only a small amount of fuel is added to the tank, the display may not be updated.When refueling, turn the engine switch off. If the vehicle is refueled without turning the engine switch off, the display may not be updated.

advanced_description.title: Fuel economy
advanced_description.p_sub: Use the displayed values as a reference only.

calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: To reset the average fuel economy display, press and hold the meter control switch.
Displays instantaneous current fuel consumption.
Displays driving range with remaining fuel.
This distance is computed based on your average fuel consumption. As a result, the actual distance that can be driven may differ from that displayed.

When only a small amount of fuel is added to the tank, the display may not be updated.When refueling, turn the engine switch off. If the vehicle is refueled without turning the engine switch off, the display may not be updated.

advanced_description.p: The average fuel economy display can be changed in . (→)

list1_item.itemtxt_sub: Displays the average fuel consumption since engine start.
Displays the average fuel consumption since the vehicle was refueled.

calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: During Eco-friendly acceleration (Eco driving), the Eco Driving Indicator Light will turn on. When the acceleration exceeds the Zone of Eco driving, or when the vehicle is stopped, the light turns off.
Suggests the Zone of Eco driving with current Eco driving ratio based on acceleration.

calloutitem.callouttxt: Eco driving ratio based on acceleration
calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: If the acceleration exceeds the Zone of Eco driving, the right side of the Eco Driving Indicator Zone Display will illuminate.
At this time, the Eco Driving Indicator Light will turn off.

list1_item.itemtxt: Displays driving range with remaining fuel. Use the displayed values as a reference only.
This distance is computed based on your average fuel consumption. As a result, the actual distance that can be driven may differ from that displayed.

When only a small amount of fuel is added to the tank, the display may not be updated.When refueling, turn the engine switch off. If the vehicle is refueled without turning the engine switch off, the display may not be updated.

note_para.title: Eco Driving Indicator
note_para.p: Eco Driving Indicator will not operate under the following conditions:

att_list1_item.itemtxt: The shift lever is in any position other than D.
The driving mode is set to sport mode. (if equipped)
The vehicle speed is approximately 130 km/h (80 mph) or higher.

advanced_description.title: Driving support system information
advanced_description.p: Select to display the operational status of the following systems:

list1_item.itemtxt: LDA (Lane Departure Alert with steering control) (if equipped) (→)
Dynamic radar cruise control with full-speed range (if equipped) (→)

advanced_description.title: Navigation system-linked display (if equipped)
advanced_description.p: Select to display the following navigation system-linked information:

note_para.title: Route guidance to destination display
note_para.p: When the route guidance to destination display is enabled on the head-up display, it will not be displayed on the multi-information display. (→)

advanced_description.p: Select to enable selection of an audio source or track on the meter using the meter control switches.
advanced_description.p_sub: This menu icon can be set to be displayed/not displayed in .

advanced_description.title: Drive information
advanced_description.p_sub: Displays drive information such as the following:
advanced_description.p: Displays the following depending on which drive information type and drive information items were selected in . (→)

list2_item.itemtxt: Distance: Displays the distance driven since engine start
Elapsed time: Displays the elapsed time since engine start
Average vehicle speed: Displays the average vehicle speed since engine start
Distance: Displays the distance driven since the display was reset*
Elapsed time: Displays the elapsed time since the display was reset*
Average vehicle speed: Displays the average vehicle speed since the display was reset*

footnote.p: To reset, display the desired item and press and hold the meter control switch.

advanced_description.title: Meter display settings that can be changed

list1_item.itemtxt_sub: Select to change the language displayed.
Select to change the units of measure displayed.
Select to set the display of the speedometer to analog/digital.
Select to enable/disable the Eco Driving Indicator Light.

list2_item.itemtxt: Fuel economy display
list2_item.itemtxt_sub: Select to change the average fuel consumption display between after start/after reset. (→)

list1_item.itemtxt_sub: Select to display/not display the audio system linked display.
Select to change the displayed content of the following:

list2_item.itemtxt: Drive information type
list2_item.itemtxt_sub: Select to change the drive information type display between after start/after reset.

list2_item.itemtxt: Drive information items
list2_item.itemtxt_sub: Select to set the first and second items of the drive information display to any of the following: average vehicle speed/distance/elapsed time.

list1_item.itemtxt_sub: Select to enable/disable pop-up displays for each relevant system.
Select to turn the multi-information display off.
To turn the multi-information display on again, press any of the following meter control switches /////.
Select to reset the meter display settings to the default setting.

advanced_description.title: Vehicle functions and settings that can be changed

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Some settings cannot be changed while driving. When changing settings, park the vehicle in a safe place.
If a warning message is displayed, operation of the settings display will be suspended.

attention_para.title: Cautions during setting up the display
attention_para.p: If the engine is running when changing the display settings, ensure that the vehicle is parked in a place with adequate ventilation. In a closed area such as a garage, exhaust gases including harmful carbon monoxide (CO) may collect and enter the vehicle. This may lead to death or a serious health hazard.

attention_para.title: During setting up the display
attention_para.p: To prevent battery discharge, ensure that the engine is running while setting up the display features.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: The head-up display projects a variety of driving-related information and the operating state of the driving support systems on the windshield.

fig.p: Illustrations used in this text are intended as examples, and may differ from the image that is actually displayed by the head-up display.

calloutitem.callouttxt: Driving support system status/navigation system-linked display area (if equipped) (→)
Tachometer/Eco Driving Indicator/Outside temperature display area (→)

note_para.title: Head-up display will operate when
note_para.p: The engine switch is in ON.

note_para.title: When using the head-up display
note_para.p: The head-up display may seem dark or hard to see when viewed through sunglasses, especially polarized sunglasses. Adjust the brightness of the head-up display or remove your sunglasses.

note_para.title: Street name display (vehicles with navigation system)
note_para.p: Only street names which are included in the map data will be displayed.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Check that the position and brightness of the head-up display image does not interfere with safe driving. Incorrect adjustment of the image’s position or brightness may obstruct the driver’s view and lead to an accident, resulting in death or serious injury.
Do not continuously look at the head-up display while driving as you may fail to see pedestrians, objects on the road, etc. ahead of the vehicle.
Do not place any drinks near the head-up display projector. If the projector gets wet, electrical malfunctions may result.
Do not place anything on or put stickers onto the head-up display projector. Doing so could interrupt head-up display indications.
Do not touch the inside of the head-up display projector or thrust sharp edges or the like into the projector. Doing so could cause mechanical malfunctions.

advanced_description.p: Select on the multi-information display (→) and then “HUD Main”.

advanced_description.title: Enabling/disabling the head-up display
advanced_description.p: Press the meter control switch to enable/disable the head-up display.

advanced_description.title: Changing the head-up display settings
advanced_description.p: Press and hold the meter control switch to change the following settings:

list1_item.itemtxt: Brightness and vertical position of the head-up display
list1_item.itemtxt_sub: Select to adjust the brightness or vertical position of the head-up display.

list1_item.itemtxt: Select to change the display between the following:

list2_item.itemtxt: No content
Eco Driving Indicator
Tachometer

list1_item.itemtxt: Select to enable/disable the following items:

list2_item.itemtxt: Route guidance to destination (if equipped)
Driving support system display (if equipped)
Compass (heading-up display) (if equipped)
Audio system operation status (if equipped)

list1_item.itemtxt_sub: Select to adjust the angle of the head-up display.

note_para.title: Enabling/disabling of the head-up display
note_para.p: If the head-up display is disabled, it will remain disabled when the engine switch is turned off then back to ON.

note_para.title: Display brightness
note_para.p: The brightness of the head-up display can be adjusted on of the multi-information display. Also, it is automatically adjusted according to the ambient brightness.

attention_para.title: Caution for changing settings of the head-up display
attention_para.p: If the engine is running when changing the display settings, ensure that the vehicle is parked in a place with adequate ventilation. In a closed area such as a garage, exhaust gases including harmful carbon monoxide (CO) may collect and enter the vehicle. This may lead to death or a serious health hazard.

attention_para.title: When changing the settings of the head-up display
attention_para.p: To prevent battery discharge, ensure that the engine is running while changing the settings of the head-up display.

titlegroupcell.title: Driving support system status/navigation system-linked display area (if equipped)

advanced_description.title: Driving support system status display
advanced_description.p: Displays the operational status of the following systems:

list1_item.itemtxt: Dynamic radar cruise control with full-speed range (if equipped) (→)
LDA (Lane Departure Alert with steering control) (if equipped) (→)

advanced_description.p_sub: Details of content displayed on the head-up display may differ from that displayed on the multi-information display. For details, refer to the explanation of each system.

advanced_description.title: Navigation system-linked display area (if equipped)
advanced_description.p: Displays the following items which are linked to the navigation system:
Pop-up displays for the following systems will be displayed when necessary:

advanced_description.title: Driving support systems
advanced_description.p: Displays a warning/suggestion/advice message or the operating state of a relevant system.
advanced_description.p_sub: Details of content displayed on the head-up display may differ from that displayed on the multi-information display. For details, refer to the explanation of each system.

advanced_description.title: icon
advanced_description.p: Displayed when a warning message is displayed on the multi-information display. (→)

advanced_description.title: Warning message
advanced_description.p: Some warning messages are displayed when necessary, according to certain conditions.
advanced_description.p_sub: Details of content displayed on the head-up display may differ from that displayed on the multi-information display.

advanced_description.title: Audio system operation status (if equipped)
advanced_description.p: Displayed when an audio remote control switch on the steering wheel is operated.

advanced_description.title: Hands-free system status (if equipped)
advanced_description.p: Displayed when the hands-free system is operated.

note_para.title: When a pop-up display is displayed
note_para.p: When a pop-up display is displayed, a current display may no longer be displayed. In this case, the display will return after the pop-up display disappears.

advanced_description.title: Tachometer
advanced_description.p: Displays the engine speed in revolutions per minute.

calloutitem.callouttxt: Eco driving ratio based on acceleration

calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: Displayed content is the same as that displayed on the multi-information display (Eco Driving Indicator). For details, refer to .

advanced_description.title: Outside temperature display
advanced_description.p: Displayed when the engine switch is turned to ON or when the low outside temperature indicator is flashing.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: When the ambient temperature is approximately 3°C (37°F) or lower, the low outside temperature indicator will flash for approximately 10 seconds and the outside temperature display will turn off. In this case, the display will be displayed again when the outside temperature becomes approximately 5°C (41°F) or higher.
In the following situations, the correct outside temperature may not be displayed, or the display may take longer than normal to change:

att_list2_item.itemtxt: When stopped, or driving at low speeds (less than 25 km/h [16 mph])
When the outside temperature has changed suddenly (at the entrance/exit of a garage, tunnel, etc.)

att_list1_item.itemtxt: When “--” or “E” is displayed, the system may be malfunctioning. Take your vehicle to your Toyota dealer.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: Fuel consumption information can be displayed on the audio system screen.

advanced_operation.title: Trip information

stepitem.steptxt_sub: If a screen other than “Trip information” is displayed, select “Trip information”.

calloutitem.callouttxt: Fuel consumption in the past 15 minutes
Average vehicle speed since the engine was started.
Elapsed time since the engine was started.

advanced_operation.p: Average fuel consumption for the past 15 minutes is divided by color into past averages and averages attained since the engine switch was last turned to ON. Use the displayed average fuel consumption as a reference.
advanced_operation.p_sub: The image is an example only, and may vary slightly from actual conditions.

advanced_operation.title: History

stepitem.steptxt_sub: If a screen other than “History” is displayed, select “History”.

calloutitem.callouttxt: Updating the latest fuel consumption data

advanced_operation.p: The average fuel consumption history is divided by color into past averages and the average fuel consumption since the last updated. Use the displayed average fuel consumption as a reference.
advanced_operation.p_sub: The image is an example only, and may vary slightly from actual conditions.

note_para.title: Updating the history data
note_para.p: Update the latest fuel consumption by selecting “Clip” to measure the current fuel consumption again.

note_para.title: Resetting the data
note_para.p: The fuel consumption data can be deleted by selecting “Clear”.

note_para.title: Cruising range
note_para.p: Displays the estimated maximum distance that can be driven with the quantity of fuel remaining.
This distance is computed based on your average fuel consumption. As a result, the actual distance that can be driven may differ from that displayed.
